# isAliasable()

**Instance Method**

A Boolean value that indicates whether future heap resource allocations may alias against the resource’s memory.

## Declaration

```swift
func isAliasable() -> Bool
```

## Return Value

The default value is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false]. The value is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] only if the [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLResource/makeAliasable()] method was previously called on this resource.

## Managing heap resources

- **heapOffset**: The distance, in bytes, from the beginning of the heap to the first byte of the resource, if you allocated the resource on a heap.
- **heap**: The heap on which the resource is allocated, if any.
- **makeAliasable()**: Allows future heap resource allocations to alias against the resource’s memory, reusing it.
